snippet: A 36-year resident of the Ansonia has spent the past three and a half years in a testy legal dispute to determine if she can keep her rent-stabilized apartment.
abstract: The Appraisal; Marieliz Unwin, a resident of the Ansonia on Manhattan’s Upper West Side has spent the past three and a half years years in a testy legal dispute to determine if she can keep her rent-stabilized apartment; building owners argue that her true home is a farmhouse in upstate and have employed high-powered lawyers, undercover detectives and reams of personal documents, to try to force her out.
lead_paragraph: A 36-year resident of the Ansonia has spent the past three and a half years in a testy legal dispute to determine if she can keep her rent-stabilized apartment.

headline.main: Long Fight to Keep a Grand Address on the Upper West Side
headline.print_headline: Long Fight to Keep a Grand Address on the Upper West Side
